fields.summary: euca-describe-groups displays security groups ingressed for a particular security group different than ec2-authorize/aws ec2 describe-security-groups

fields.description:
*Assessment*

When adding ELB security group to ensure that a back-end Eucalyptus EC2 instance receives traffic only from ELB instance, the user needs to do the following:
{code}
$ euca-authorize default -u 944786667073 -o euca-internal-408396244283-NginxLoadBalancer -p 0-65535
{code}
However, when removing this rule, if the user runs the following command, this fails (even though we return no error):
{code}
[root@odc-f-13 ~]# euca-revoke default -u 944786667073 -o euca-internal-408396244283-NginxLoadBalancer -p 0-65535 --region account1-user01@VLADR
GROUP	default
PERMISSION	default	ALLOWS	tcp	0	65535	USER	944786667073	GRPNAME	euca-internal-408396244283-NginxLoadBalancer	FROM	CIDR	0.0.0.0/0

[root@odc-f-13 ~]# euca-describe-groups --region account1-user01@VLADR
GROUP	sg-A5133B59	408396244283	default	default group
PERMISSION	408396244283	default	ALLOWS	tcp	0	65535	FROM	USER	944786667073	ID	sg-A8383E29	ingress
PERMISSION	408396244283	default	ALLOWS	tcp	80	80	FROM	CIDR	0.0.0.0/0	ingress
PERMISSION	408396244283	default	ALLOWS	tcp	22	22	FROM	CIDR	0.0.0.0/0	ingress
PERMISSION	408396244283	default	ALLOWS	icmp	-1	-1	FROM	CIDR	0.0.0.0/0	ingress
{code}
In order to remove this security group, the end user needs to use the security group name thats in the output of 'euca-describe-groups':
{code}
[root@odc-f-13 ~]# euca-describe-groups --region account1-user01@VLADR
GROUP	sg-A5133B59	408396244283	default	default group
PERMISSION	408396244283	default	ALLOWS	tcp	0	65535	FROM	USER	944786667073	ID	sg-A8383E29	ingress
PERMISSION	408396244283	default	ALLOWS	tcp	80	80	FROM	CIDR	0.0.0.0/0	ingress
PERMISSION	408396244283	default	ALLOWS	tcp	22	22	FROM	CIDR	0.0.0.0/0	ingress
PERMISSION	408396244283	default	ALLOWS	icmp	-1	-1	FROM	CIDR	0.0.0.0/0	ingress

[root@odc-f-13 ~]# euca-revoke default -u 944786667073 -o sg-A8383E29 -p 0-65535 --region account1-user01@VLADR
GROUP	default
PERMISSION	default	ALLOWS	tcp	0	65535	USER	944786667073	GRPID	sg-A8383E29	FROM	CIDR	0.0.0.0/0

[root@odc-f-13 ~]# euca-describe-groups --region account1-user01@VLADR
GROUP	sg-A5133B59	408396244283	default	default group
PERMISSION	408396244283	default	ALLOWS	tcp	80	80	FROM	CIDR	0.0.0.0/0	ingress
PERMISSION	408396244283	default	ALLOWS	tcp	22	22	FROM	CIDR	0.0.0.0/0	ingress
PERMISSION	408396244283	default	ALLOWS	icmp	-1	-1	FROM	CIDR	0.0.0.0/0	ingress
{code}

This behavior does not match AWS:

*authorizing security group*
{code}
euca-prod-1-82:~ haroldspencerjr$ aws ec2 describe-security-groups --group-name default --profile harold-workSECURITYGROUPS	default group	sg-772c811f	default	048212016277
IPPERMISSIONS	-1	icmp	-1
USERIDGROUPPAIRS	sg-772c811f	default	048212016277
IPPERMISSIONS	0	tcp	65535
USERIDGROUPPAIRS	sg-772c811f	default	048212016277
IPPERMISSIONS	0	udp	65535
USERIDGROUPPAIRS	sg-772c811f	default	048212016277
IPPERMISSIONS	22	tcp	22
IPRANGES	0.0.0.0/0
IPRANGES	174.76.114.0/24
IPPERMISSIONS	53	tcp	53
IPRANGES	0.0.0.0/0
IPPERMISSIONS	80	tcp	80
IPRANGES	0.0.0.0/0
IPPERMISSIONS	53	udp	53
IPRANGES	0.0.0.0/0

$ aws ec2 authorize-security-group-ingress --source-security-group-owner-id amazon-elb --source-security-group-name amazon-elb-sg --profile harold-work --group-name default
true

$ aws ec2 describe-security-groups --group-name default --profile harold-workSECURITYGROUPS	default group	sg-772c811f	default	048212016277
IPPERMISSIONS	-1	icmp	-1
USERIDGROUPPAIRS	sg-843f59ed	amazon-elb-sg	amazon-elb
USERIDGROUPPAIRS	sg-772c811f	default	048212016277
IPPERMISSIONS	1	tcp	65535
USERIDGROUPPAIRS	sg-843f59ed	amazon-elb-sg	amazon-elb
IPPERMISSIONS	0	tcp	65535
USERIDGROUPPAIRS	sg-772c811f	default	048212016277
IPPERMISSIONS	1	udp	65535
USERIDGROUPPAIRS	sg-843f59ed	amazon-elb-sg	amazon-elb
IPPERMISSIONS	0	udp	65535
USERIDGROUPPAIRS	sg-772c811f	default	048212016277
IPPERMISSIONS	22	tcp	22
IPRANGES	0.0.0.0/0
IPRANGES	174.76.114.0/24
IPPERMISSIONS	53	tcp	53
IPRANGES	0.0.0.0/0
IPPERMISSIONS	80	tcp	80
IPRANGES	0.0.0.0/0
IPPERMISSIONS	53	udp	53
IPRANGES	0.0.0.0/0
{code}

*revoking*

{code}
$ aws ec2 revoke-security-group-ingress --source-security-group-owner-id amazon-elb --source-security-group-name amazon-elb-sg --profile harold-work --group-name default
true

$ aws ec2 describe-security-groups --group-name default --profile harold-workSECURITYGROUPS	default group	sg-772c811f	default	048212016277
IPPERMISSIONS	-1	icmp	-1
USERIDGROUPPAIRS	sg-772c811f	default	048212016277
IPPERMISSIONS	0	tcp	65535
USERIDGROUPPAIRS	sg-772c811f	default	048212016277
IPPERMISSIONS	0	udp	65535
USERIDGROUPPAIRS	sg-772c811f	default	048212016277
IPPERMISSIONS	22	tcp	22
IPRANGES	0.0.0.0/0
IPRANGES	174.76.114.0/24
IPPERMISSIONS	53	tcp	53
IPRANGES	0.0.0.0/0
IPPERMISSIONS	80	tcp	80
IPRANGES	0.0.0.0/0
IPPERMISSIONS	53	udp	53
IPRANGES	0.0.0.0/0
{code}
fields.summary: Each ELB has a different security group name
fields.environment:
* non-HA, single cluster
** 1 x CLC
** 1 x UFS, Walrus
** 1 x UFS
** 1 x CC, SC (overlay)
** 2 x NC

SERVICE	compute           	ShoesForRunning	ShoesForRunning.compute	ENABLED 	32  	http://10.104.1.218:8773/services/compute	arn:euca:bootstrap:ShoesForRunning:compute:ShoesForRunning.compute/
SERVICE	euare             	ShoesForRunning	ShoesForRunning.euare	ENABLED 	32  	http://10.104.1.218:8773/services/Euare	arn:euca:bootstrap:ShoesForRunning:euare:ShoesForRunning.euare/
SERVICE	loadbalancing     	ShoesForRunning	ShoesForRunning.loadbalancing	ENABLED 	32  	http://10.104.1.218:8773/services/LoadBalancing	arn:euca:bootstrap:ShoesForRunning:loadbalancing:ShoesForRunning.loadbalancing/

comments.body:
To shed more light here - on AWS, the name of the security group and security group owner are as follows:

* amazon-elb-sg
* amazon-elb

So anytime you authorize the ELB security group access to another security group, it will be the same - even after you re-create another ELB.  This keeps a user from having to re-apply security group rules if they tear down an ELB, and relaunch another.

On Eucalyptus, even though the security group name is the same, the security group ID is applied to ingress rule.  Therefore, if you tear down an ELB, and recreate another, you have to redo the security group rules.  For example:

*new ELB*
{code}
[root@odc-f-13 ~]# eulb-describe-lbs --show-long --region account1-user01@
LOAD_BALANCER	SSLNginxLoadBalancer	SSLNginxLoadBalancer-408396244283.elb.acme.eucalyptus-systems.com			{interval=30,target=TCP:80,timeout=5,healthy-threshold=3,unhealthy-threshold=2}	ViciousLiesAndDangerousRumors				{protocol=HTTP,lb-port=80,instance-protocol=HTTP,instance-port=80},{protocol=HTTPS,lb-port=443,instance-protocol=HTTP,instance-port=80,cert-id=arn:aws:iam::408396244283:server-certificate/acmes-dev-eucalyptus}					{owner-alias=944786667073,group-name=euca-internal-408396244283-SSLNginxLoadBalancer}		2014-05-30T15:27:05.312Z
{code}

*ingress rules on security group*
{code}
[root@odc-f-13 ~]# euca-describe-groups --region account1-user01@ ssl-nginx
GROUP	sg-5F6ACB71	408396244283	ssl-nginx	Security Group for HTTPS/SSL Nginx Web Servers
PERMISSION	408396244283	ssl-nginx	ALLOWS	tcp	22	22	FROM	CIDR	0.0.0.0/0	ingress
PERMISSION	408396244283	ssl-nginx	ALLOWS	tcp	1	65535	FROM	USER	944786667073	ID	sg-C41CB839	ingress
{code}

*security group for ELB*
{code}
[root@odc-f-13 ~]# euca-describe-groups --region admin@ euca-internal-408396244283-SSLNginxLoadBalancer
GROUP	sg-ABE9B261	944786667073	euca-internal-408396244283-SSLNginxLoadBalancer	group for loadbalancer SSLNginxLoadBalancer
PERMISSION	944786667073	euca-internal-408396244283-SSLNginxLoadBalancer	ALLOWS	tcp	80	80	FROM	CIDR	0.0.0.0/0	ingress
PERMISSION	944786667073	euca-internal-408396244283-SSLNginxLoadBalancer	ALLOWS	tcp	443	443	FROM	CIDR	0.0.0.0/0	ingress
TAG	security-group	sg-ABE9B261	Name	loadbalancer-resources
{code}

The security group ID 'sg-ABE9B261' changed for the ELB security group.  Therefore the cloud user has to re-authorize the ingress rules.  This will cause a lot of issues for users - especially dealing with a cloud maintenance situation.

*Steps to Reproduction*

* Set up Eucalyptus 4.0 Cloud
* Create an ELB
{code}
# eulb-create-lb SSLNginxLoadBalancer -z ViciousLiesAndDangerousRumors -l "lb-port=80, protocol=HTTP, instance-port=80, instance-protocol=HTTP" -l "lb-port=443, protocol=https, instance-port=80, instance-protocol=http, cert-id=arn:aws:iam::408396244283:server-certificate/acmes-dev-eucalyptus" --region account1-user01@
# eulb-describe-lbs
LOAD_BALANCER	SSLNginxLoadBalancer	SSLNginxLoadBalancer-408396244283.elb.acme.eucalyptus-systems.com	2014-05-30T15:27:05.312Z

** Look at security group associated with ELB as cloud admin **
# euca-describe-groups --region admin@ euca-internal-408396244283-SSLNginxLoadBalancer
GROUP	sg-ABE9B261	944786667073	euca-internal-408396244283-SSLNginxLoadBalancer	group for loadbalancer SSLNginxLoadBalancer
PERMISSION	944786667073	euca-internal-408396244283-SSLNginxLoadBalancer	ALLOWS	tcp	80	80	FROM	CIDR	0.0.0.0/0	ingress
PERMISSION	944786667073	euca-internal-408396244283-SSLNginxLoadBalancer	ALLOWS	tcp	443	443	FROM	CIDR	0.0.0.0/0	ingress
TAG	security-group	sg-ABE9B261	Name	loadbalancer-resources
{code}
* Create a security group
{code}
# euca-create-group ssl-nginx -d "Security Group for HTTPS/SSL Nginx Web Servers"
{code}
* Authorize ingress rules to ssl-nginx security group for ELB
{code}
# euca-authorize ssl-nginx -u 944786667073 -o euca-internal-408396244283-SSLNginxLoadBalancer -p -1 
GROUP	ssl-nginx
PERMISSION	ssl-nginx	ALLOWS	tcp	1	65535	USER	944786667073	GRPNAME	euca-internal-408396244283-SSLNginxLoadBalancer	FROM	CIDR	0.0.0.0/0

** describe security group nginx and notice security group ID used for ELB **
# euca-describe-groups  ssl-nginx
GROUP	sg-5F6ACB71	408396244283	ssl-nginx	Security Group for HTTPS/SSL Nginx Web Servers
PERMISSION	408396244283	ssl-nginx	ALLOWS	tcp	1	65535	FROM	USER	944786667073	ID	sg-ABE9B261	ingress
PERMISSION	408396244283	ssl-nginx	ALLOWS	tcp	22	22	FROM	CIDR	0.0.0.0/0	ingress
{code}
* Delete ELB
{code}
# eulb-delete-lb SSLNginxLoadBalancer
{code}
* Recreate ELB
{code}
# eulb-create-lb SSLNginxLoadBalancer -z ViciousLiesAndDangerousRumors -l "lb-port=80, protocol=HTTP, instance-port=80, instance-protocol=HTTP" -l "lb-port=443, protocol=https, instance-port=80, instance-protocol=http, cert-id=arn:aws:iam::408396244283:server-certificate/acmes-dev-eucalyptus" --region account1-user01@
DNS_NAME	SSLNginxLoadBalancer-408396244283.elb.acme.eucalyptus-systems.com

# eulb-describe-lbs --show-long --region account1-user01@
LOAD_BALANCER	SSLNginxLoadBalancer	SSLNginxLoadBalancer-408396244283.elb.acme.eucalyptus-systems.com			{interval=30,target=TCP:80,timeout=5,healthy-threshold=3,unhealthy-threshold=2}	ViciousLiesAndDangerousRumors				{protocol=HTTP,lb-port=80,instance-protocol=HTTP,instance-port=80},{protocol=HTTPS,lb-port=443,instance-protocol=HTTP,instance-port=80,cert-id=arn:aws:iam::408396244283:server-certificate/acmes-dev-eucalyptus}					{owner-alias=944786667073,group-name=euca-internal-408396244283-SSLNginxLoadBalancer}		2014-05-30T16:20:44.248Z
{code}
* Check security group ID for Load Balancer as cloud admin
{code}
# euca-describe-groups --region admin@ euca-internal-408396244283-SSLNginxLoadBalancer
GROUP	sg-5DFC77A3	944786667073	euca-internal-408396244283-SSLNginxLoadBalancer	group for loadbalancer SSLNginxLoadBalancer
PERMISSION	944786667073	euca-internal-408396244283-SSLNginxLoadBalancer	ALLOWS	tcp	80	80	FROM	CIDR	0.0.0.0/0	ingress
PERMISSION	944786667073	euca-internal-408396244283-SSLNginxLoadBalancer	ALLOWS	tcp	443	443	FROM	CIDR	0.0.0.0/0	ingress
TAG	security-group	sg-5DFC77A3	Name	loadbalancer-resources
{code}

Notice that the first time the ELB was created, the security group 'sg-ABE9B261' was used.  After the ELB was deleted, and an ELB with the same name was created, the security group id is now 'sg-5DFC77A3', which doesn't match the security group authorized previously.  

*Workaround*

* User will have to delete the first ELB security group by using the security group ID:
{code}
# euca-describe-groups ssl-nginx --region account1-user01@
GROUP	sg-5F6ACB71	408396244283	ssl-nginx	Security Group for HTTPS/SSL Nginx Web Servers
PERMISSION	408396244283	ssl-nginx	ALLOWS	tcp	1	65535	FROM	USER	944786667073	ID	sg-ABE9B261	ingress
PERMISSION	408396244283	ssl-nginx	ALLOWS	tcp	22	22	FROM	CIDR	0.0.0.0/0	ingress

# euca-revoke ssl-nginx -u 944786667073 -o sg-ABE9B261 -p -1 --region account1-user01@
GROUP	ssl-nginx
PERMISSION	ssl-nginx	ALLOWS	tcp	1	65535	USER	944786667073	GRPID	sg-ABE9B261	FROM	CIDR	0.0.0.0/0
{code}
* Reauthorize the ELB security group name again to the same security group
{code}
# euca-authorize ssl-nginx -u 944786667073 -o euca-internal-408396244283-SSLNginxLoadBalancer -p -1 --region account1-user01@
GROUP	ssl-nginx
PERMISSION	ssl-nginx	ALLOWS	tcp	1	65535	USER	944786667073	GRPNAME	euca-internal-408396244283-SSLNginxLoadBalancer	FROM	CIDR	0.0.0.0/0

# euca-describe-groups ssl-nginx --region account1-user01@
GROUP	sg-5F6ACB71	408396244283	ssl-nginx	Security Group for HTTPS/SSL Nginx Web Servers
PERMISSION	408396244283	ssl-nginx	ALLOWS	tcp	1	65535	FROM	USER	944786667073	ID	sg-5DFC77A3	ingress
PERMISSION	408396244283	ssl-nginx	ALLOWS	tcp	22	22	FROM	CIDR	0.0.0.0/0	ingress
{code}

*Pertinent Data*

This causes extra work for cloud users in the following situations:

* After a cloud maintenance outage
* If the cloud user for some reason deletes an ELB and recreates it with the same name

[~hspencer], when you delete a load balancer then the security group associated with it should be deleted as well. I think that since the load balancer's security group is used for ingress rule the delete is not successful. There should probably be another issue opened to handle cleanup of this case when an ELB is deleted.
Created KB Article - [Eucalyptus vs. AWS - Differences in Ingress Security Group Authorization for Elastic Load Balancing (ELB)|https://support.eucalyptus.com/hc/en-us/articles/202221554]
